<< rref Linear algebra schur >>

rsf2csf

Convert real Schur form to complex Schur form.

Syntax

[Uc, Tc] = rsf2csf(U, T)

Input argument

U

unitary matrix (double or single, real or complex)

T

schur form (double or single, real or complex)

Output argument

Uc

transformed unitary matrix

Tc

transformed schur form

Description

[Uc, Tc] = rsf2csf(U, T) transforms the outputs of [U, T] = schur(X) for real matrices X from real Schur form to complex Schur form.

Example

X = [1,     1,     1,     3;
     1,     2,     1,     1;
     1,     1,     3,     1;
    -2,     1,     1,     4];
[U, T] = schur(X)
[Uc, Tc] = rsf2csf(U, T)

See also

schur.

History

Version Description
1.0.0 initial version

Author

Allan CORNET
